rounds.comments: [NOTE: That is how the category name was displayed.]

clues.text: On his 1952 musical variety show, the orchestra was led by his brother George
Singer Cricket Blake hung out with the "eyes" from this tropical private detective firm
This anthology series finished 6th in the '56-'57 season & 49th in '85-'86
According to the series title, Charles Bronson was "A Man with..." one of these
In the opening, the announcer said these 2 "present 'The Mickey Mouse Club'"

MMM:
that kind of says it all

AFL:
if it walks like a duck...

SCHW:
we're invested in your response

CMCSA:
your technician will arrive between 7 A.M. & 11 P.M. (We kid, there's a 2-hour window)

GIS:
Cheerios & Yoplait are on us!
Around 40 A.D. if you said Caesar's this type of home, you meant the one near the Roman Forum
This small room on a ship precedes "fever" regarding restlessness due to longtime confinement
From the Hindustani word bangla, it's a one-story house with a thatched roof
It can mean joint rule of a territory, but we associate this word more with an individually owned apartment
Yo ho, now we set sail / Of this kind of home, I'll tell you a tale / A wooden hut & sailor's song it is / & now be the end o' our quiz
This troubled title guy says the Danes are known as drunkards to other nations
"The gentleman had drunk himself out of his five sentences" is in the first scene of this play, getting "merry" from the start
In "Othello", Cassio tells this man, "I have very poor & unhappy brains for drinking" & he replies, "I'll drink for you"
A warning in "As You Like It": "Do not fall in love with me, for I am falser than vows made in" this intoxicant
In this comedy Sir Toby Belch asks, "Dost thou think, because thou art virtuous, there shall be no more cakes & ale?"
It's a short commute for Santa to get to this frigid Russian region of nearly 5 million sq. mi. that includes the Ob & Yenisey Rivers
Santa Claus can cruise into Ho-Ho-Ho Chi Minh City along the river with this name, the former name of Ho Chi Minh City
Peshawar, Lahore & Karachi are but 3 city stops as St. Nick soars around this country
Mr. C. is very busy island hopping in this nation in the Pacific; Leyte is just one of its more than 1,000 inhabited islands
Santa's sleigh touches down on Honshu in this city of 1.5 million, Japan's capital from 794 to 1868
The rather animated Clancy Wiggum
Bar regular Cliff Clavin
Assane Diop on "Lupin" is a "gentleman" one
Diane Lockhart on 2 series
Miserable & middle-aged Al Bundy
Renee Fleming made her debut at the Met as Countess Almaviva in this Mozart opera whose title promises a wedding
Act I of this Rossini opera is set on the shores of Lake Lucerne
Composer Philip Glass said his work this man "on the Beach" is "an opera about a great mathematician who loved music"
One of the librettists of this Puccini opera went to Nagasaki to help set the scene more accurately
Dr. Grenvil examines Violetta in act 3 of this Verdi opera, but it is too late--she dies in her lover's arms

rounds.category: ANGELS WE HAVE HEARD ON HIGH

clues.text: At least back to the 17th century angels have been depicted playing this stringed instrument, still part of the modern orchestra
This sacred tome was revealed by an angel to Muhammad in Mecca & Medina
On angelic love, Raphael says in this man's "Paradise Lost", "Whatever pure thou in the body enjoy'st... we enjoy"
This angel proclaims, "And, behold, thy cousin Elisabeth, she hath also conceived a son in her old age"
This Tony Kushner play has the line "Greetings prophet; the great work begins: the messenger has arrived"
Silver iodide is often used to produce condensation for "seeding" these
In vein & placer deposits, gold often appears with fool's gold, also called this
When they're bars & ingots, gold & silver are called this, which sounds like a soup broth
Gold is virtually indestructible, yet has this moldable quality, from the Latin for "to hammer"
Silver is valuable due to its brilliance, scarcity & resistance to this process, meaning it won't rust
Father Michael McGivney founded a Catholic service organization & called it the Knights of this sailor of 1492
Angelo Tancredi was the first knight to join the order of this man of Assisi & was singing to him when he died
Knight-turned-missionary Ramon Llull wrote a manual of this, the honorable conduct expected of knights
Led by Hugh de Payns, they formed in the early 12th century to protect pilgrims headed to Jerusalem
Minister Thomas W. Stringer formed the African-American version of the "Knights of" him, Damon's friend

rounds.category: A DIFFERENT LOOK AT CHRISTMAS SONGS

clues.text: He's "the most famous reindeer of all", but he's bullied horribly & only loved after bailing everyone out on Christmas Eve
This title daredevil lives to the max! Though the Sun can kill him, he sings, "Let's run & we'll have some fun now before I melt away"
"Please, Daddy (Don't Get Drunk This Christmas)" is by this "Take Me Home, Country Roads" singer
You don't think of Christmas tunes as black market body part movers, but "All I Want For Christmas Is" this pair of choppers
A police report would later reveal this title relative "had hoof prints on her forehead & incriminating Claus marks on her back"
Katniss Everdeen
Clarice Starling
Antonia Shimerda
V.I. Warshawski
Ayla, of the "Earth's Children" novels

rounds.text: Originally a term for security escorts for commanders, in 27 B.C. this group was designated an official imperial force
